alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Monroe; Summers (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 1:52PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Summers, central Mercer and southwestern Monroe Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 151 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kegley, or over Princeton, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Princeton... Hinton... Athens... Pipestem... Camp Creek... Red Sulphur Spring... and Buck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
